subject: Re: [junit] How do i check if i am getting right output
msgSnippet: ... Do you really expect exactly the string Expected output followed by a line terminator? When output might have line terminators, I prefer to parse the
messageBody:
newtojunit wrote:
> Hi,
>
> I am new to junit. I am testing a function which calls another private
> function which prints a value I want to check whether this value is as
> expected or not.
>
> I tried using the following code.
> {
> ByteArrayOutputStream output =new ByteArrayOutputStream();
> System.setOut(new PrintStream(output));
>
> Functioncall()
>
> assertEquals("Expected output\n",output.toString());
>
> }
>
> when i run junit it gives me a error. however the output is as expected.

Do you really expect exactly the string "Expected output" followed by a
line terminator?

When output might have line terminators, I prefer to parse the output
into a list of lines, that way I avoid worrying about whether it's \r,
\r\n or \n.

Fortunately, you can use the split() function on the output to get an
array of lines...

List actualLines = Arrays.asList(output.toString().split("\r\n"));
List expectedLines = Collections.singletonList("Expected output");
assertEquals(expectedLines, actualLines);

Something like that should help.
--
J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger
Diaspar Software Services
http://www.diasparsoftware.com
2005 Gordon Pask Award Winner for contribution to Agile practice
Author, JUnit Recipes: Practical Methods for Programmer Testing
